heroText: Historic town known for its temples, ghats, and Maheshwari handloom sarees.

sections.royalTownDesc: Capital of the Malwa region under Queen Ahilyabai Holkar.

sections.practicalTipsDesc: Planning your visit for a smooth experience.

overview: Maheshwar is a historic town located in the Khargone district of Madhya Pradesh, India.
Situated on the north bank of the Narmada River, it is renowned for its spiritual significance and architectural beauty.
The town served as the capital of the Malwa region during the reign of the Maratha queen Ahilyabai Holkar.
Maheshwar is famous for its handwoven Maheshwari sarees, temples, and ghats.
The majestic Maheshwar Fort and riverside temples offer a glimpse into the townâ€™s glorious past.
